Dashboard set up guide
Let’s take a closer look at how to set up the dashboard to display the data source-generated visual.
Create a data source to be displayed using the dashboard. By using a
data source based on an sql query
that generates employee data. The selected parameter is employee’s department. The parameter is set as "param_org_structure".
After saving the data, the table on the Fields tab will be filled in automatically.
After selecting the department, the source will display a list of its employees.
To create a dashboard for displaying data:
1. Select Reports → Dashboards menu items. As a result, the registry opens, in which a new instance is created using the button on the control panel.
2. Click
on the control panel, which opens a profile for a new instance, which displays a modal window for entering the dashboard name  (a full description of the dashboard settings is available
here
).
After clicking "OK", the dashboard is ready for set up.
3. To edit the dashboard visual, click
in the control panel or
in the profile workspace.
The dashboard control panel and the visual editing button in the workspace are displayed when the user has appropriate permissions.
"Reading type instances" and "Editing type instances" of the "Dashboard template" object type.
"Write" for an instance of the "Dashboard template" type that the user is working on.
For more information about configuring the visual, see the
Setting up a visual of instance
article.
4. The visual is configured by dragging the necessary elements from the Elements panel into the visual profile.
4.1. Add following
grouping elements
to the dashboard visual from the "Groupings" tab: Row and Attribute group.
4.2. Add the
The "Table" dashboard
to the visual (the table will display the data generated by the source).
4.3. Add the
"Control element" analytical dashboard
to the visual (for setting up of the data source parameter).
5. Set up of the control element to work with the table. The data source parameter is used as the control element. To set up the parameter selection:
5.1. Click
to go to the element settings and specify the following parameters:
name
is the name of the setting that will be displayed to the user;
type of control
defines how the parameter is displayed. In the current example, it is specified as a "drop–down list by object type";
object type
defines the type whose objects will be provided to the user for selection.
5.2. Save the item settings by clicking "Save"  in the modal the "Control element settings" window.
5.3. Click "Save" on the "Elements" panel. This action will create a dashboard parameter. To go to the settings of the parameter, click
to open a modal window.  To edit the parameter, double-click on the desired registry line or select a registry line and click
on the control panel:
The following fields must be filled in the dashboard parameter settings:
name
is the setting’s name;
parameter value type
;
system object type
defines the type whose objects will be provided to the user for selection.
When opening the control settings, the "Parameter Connection" field will be filled in automatically:
6. Next, click
, which opens a modal window, where the source is added.
When adding a source based on a data source, specify the "Name of the source" and select the "Data source" generated earlier. In the "Parameters" panel, specify "Parameter reference" as the value type, and in the "Dashboard Parameter" field select the previously created parameter (as mentioned in paragraph 5).
7. To set up the table:
7.1. Click
to configure the table, specify the "Table name" in the modal window and select the "Data Source" added in paragraph 5 and save.
7.2. Configure the filter to debug the data display.
7.2.1. To do this, add the visual by clicking
. The system will display the filtering settings.
Click
to add all fields..
Click
to add fields selectively.
7.2.2. To edit the names of the fields, select the field and click
to go to the editing window. For more information about the field display options, see the
article
.
7.2.3. Save the changes by clicking
. The system will display the configured dashboard table, if necessary, the filter visual can be edited or deleted. To do this, open the list of visuals and click on the corresponding icon next to the selected visual:
8. Click "Save" and "Ok" buttons on the "Elements" panel.
After setting up the required elements, the system will display the dashboard. The data limited by the selected parameter will be displayed on the dashboard in tabular form.
